<<<explanation>>>: To add a custom attribute like "android:alternativeKeyLabel" to the Key elements, you can use the following code:

1. Create a new XML file for the custom attributes, for example "custom_key.xml" in the res/values/ directory.
2. Add the custom attributes to the Key elements in the custom\_key.xml file, for example:
```xml
<resources>
    <declare-styleable name="CustomKey">
        <attr name="android:codes" format="integer" />
        <attr name="android:keyLabel" format="string" />
        <attr name="android:alternativeKeyLabel" format="string" />
    </declare-styleable>
    <item name="codes">119</item>
    <item name="keyLabel">w</item>
    <item name="alternativeKeyLabel">alt_w</item>
</resources>
```
3. In the layout file where you are using the Key elements, inflate the custom\_key.xml file and set the custom attributes for each Key element, for example:
```xml
<LinearLayout
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:orientation="vertical">

    <com.example.package.CustomKey
        android:codes="119"
        android:keyLabel="w"
        android:alternativeKeyLabel="alt_w" />

</LinearLayout>
```
By inflating the custom\_key.xml file and setting the custom attributes for each Key element, you can add custom behavior and styles to the Key elements in your app.
